infos.value: Engelbert. You have returned.
So this is «Solidus»...
You're from Leonis.
U-um...I'm Little Leela.
Your names are no concern of mine.
H-how rude!
H-hey...we've discussed this.
If it were not for Leonis meddling where it shouldn't have, Lady Machérie and Schuzelt would be—
Hold on!
What do you mean, meddling? We came to their aid.
Lady Machérie and Schuzelt would have been perfectly fine without your "aid"...
Enough, Engelbert.
At present, we ought to join hands with Leonis and fight together as allies.
Leonis is...Hourne's ally...
The next you meet King Oelde, ask that he takes care of Schuzelt for me.
Yes, Your Highness.
So Schuzelt is still at Leonis's mercy.
Then I have a message for the king as well.
Tell him that if anything happens to Schuzelt, Leonis will have made itself a new sworn enemy!
I said enough, Engelbert.
...Forgive my impertinence.
No need. I understand your concern.
After all, you and Schuzelt have known each other since long before «Solidus» was established.
I consider us closer than blood, Your Highness.
Then you should believe in Leonis. For his sake.
...Understood.
Now then, we withdraw. It is time we made our way to Leonis Castle.
We shall continue to journey toward Wezette Castle.
I see.
And what of you, Deah? Will you accompany us to Leonis Castle?
Apologies, Your Highness, but I will be going to Wezette as well.
...Are you certain? But what of the situation in Ovis?
I wish nothing more than to return home as soon as possible. But alas...
After claiming the nation of Heindler, Rundall surpasses even the mighty Hourne.
...I see. You hope to gain Leonis's support as well.
Yes, Your Highness. But that is not the only reason.
I am indebted to these Leonis soldiers for allowing me to accompany them this far. I hope to repay them.
A fair decision.
King Robb, there is one more thing we have yet to mention.
We retrieved some ancient relics from Anvil Castle. Four, in fact.
Four ancient relics, you say!?
However, all were stolen by Sadali's underlings.
So he has acquired four relics... A frightening revelation.
Forgive us, Your Highness.
We were left with no choice but to flee after the loss of Queen Helena and Sir Owe...
I had not yet been informed. I pray that their souls may find peace.
Thank you, Your Highness.
You must go quite far out of your way to avoid Sadali's forces. Shall I arrange a convoy?
Much appreciated, but we will manage on our own.
Then I shall pray that your blades remain sharp and your shields sturdy.
I leave the rearguard to you, Engelbert.
Of course, Your Highness.
With that, I do believe it is high time we embarked.
